content.raw:
nit Uber minor, feel free to ignore, but:

`a frame` and `a mobilized frame` sound too generic upon rereading in the preview.

Perhaps the better wording is:

* `Jf` is the frame fixed to the parent link
* `Jm` is the frame fixed to the child link

Saying `mobilized` here is a wee bit confusing, because we don’t really talk about “mobilization” anywhere else.
content.html:
nit Uber minor, feel free to ignore, but:

a frame and a mobilized frame sound too generic upon rereading in the preview.

Perhaps the better wording is:

  • Jf is the frame fixed to the parent link
  • Jm is the frame fixed to the child link

Saying mobilized here is a wee bit confusing, because we don’t really talk about “mobilization” anywhere else.

content.html: Yup, sounds good to me.

content.html: Looks good! I'm actually mebbe too strongly opinionated about AB vs 12 or 34 for delineation, but I’ll slate that for a follow-up PR.

content.raw:
I’ve seen this figure a few times, and it’s always confused me a bit to see them side-by-side.

Can these be placed on separate lines?

Also, can they use the same notation, if they refer to the different models?

Perhaps introduce XML first, then picture?

content.raw: Per above comment, would actually prefer stripping out equation. \(and avoid denoting `J0` if it’s not to be used elsewhere\)
content.html: Per above comment, would actually prefer stripping out equation. (and avoid denoting J0 if it’s not to be used elsewhere)

content.raw:
Would prefer to replace the entire paragraph with:

‌

Some joint types allow degrees of freedom along a specified axis; the following frames are denoted:

* `Jf` is the frame attached to the parent link
* `Jm` is the mobilized frame attached to the child link
* `J` is the joint frame. The spec is ambiguous about this frame after motion; however, at the initial configuration \(`q0`\), the frames `J`, `Jf`, and `Jm` are all coincident.

‌

Then we can eliminate the equation \(as it's a bit ambiguous to denote the frame as a pure function of `q` without relative transforms\).
content.html:
Would prefer to replace the entire paragraph with:

‌

Some joint types allow degrees of freedom along a specified axis; the following frames are denoted:

  • Jf is the frame attached to the parent link
  • Jm is the mobilized frame attached to the child link
  • J is the joint frame. The spec is ambiguous about this frame after motion; however, at the initial configuration (q0), the frames J, Jf, and Jm are all coincident.

‌

Then we can eliminate the equation (as it's a bit ambiguous to denote the frame as a pure function of q without relative transforms).

content.raw: Readability is hard with this being inline. Can you make this a code block?
content.html: Readability is hard with this being inline. Can you make this a code block?

content.raw:
In this and other sections, this introduces versions; however, this is implicit to this tutorial.

If there are no distinctions to be drawn at present, can we remove mentions of versions?
content.html:
In this and other sections, this introduces versions; however, this is implicit to this tutorial.

If there are no distinctions to be drawn at present, can we remove mentions of versions?
